title: 107_s741
content: The "Nuclear Renewal Act of 2001" is cited as the short title. It introduces a credit for production from nuclear power plants under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The Nuclear Renewal Act of 2001 introduces a tax credit for electricity production from qualified nuclear power facilities, with a rate of .34 cents per kilowatt hour sold to an unrelated person. The Nuclear Renewal Act of 2001 offers a tax credit for qualified nuclear power facilities, limited to $50,000,000 per year. A qualified facility is one with an approved construction license from the Nuclear Regulatory Commission and placed in service after the enactment of the Act. The Nuclear Renewal Act of 2001 provides a tax credit for qualified nuclear power facilities that were placed in service after the enactment of the Act or resumed service after a period of at least 10 years of non-operation. A qualified nuclear power facility upgrade refers to an upgrade that allows electricity production exceeding the original rated thermal power of the facility before the upgrade. The upgrade must be approved by the Nuclear Regulatory Commission for the credit to be effective. The Nuclear Renewal Act of 2001 provides a tax credit for qualified nuclear power facilities, allowing for the transferability of the credit through agreements with electricity producers. Certain tax-exempt organizations and governmental units are also eligible for the credit under specific conditions. The Nuclear Renewal Act of 2001 provides a tax credit for qualified nuclear power facilities, allowing for transferability of the credit. Entities eligible for the credit can transfer it in accordance with specific rules. The credit is treated as a business credit under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The section does not apply to production in taxable years beginning after December 31, 2011. The Nuclear Renewal Act of 2001 provides a tax credit for qualified nuclear power facilities, allowing for transferability of the credit. The credit is treated as a business credit under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. No carryback of the section 45E credit is allowed before the effective date of the act. The Nuclear Renewal Act of 2001 provides a tax credit for qualified nuclear power facilities under section 45E. The amendments made by this act apply to production after the enactment date. SEC. 4. DEPRECIATION OF PROPERTY USED IN THE GENERATION OF ELECTRICITY. Amends the Internal Revenue Code to include property used in electricity generation as depreciable under a 10-year class life. Amends the Internal Revenue Code to define "property used in the generation of electricity" as property used in qualified nuclear power facilities or upgrades. The amendments made by this section define "property used in the generation of electricity" as property used in qualified nuclear power facilities or upgrades, and apply to property placed in service after the date of the enactment of this Act.
